component.text:
Activity - Part 1: Identify the Troubleshooting Solution
In the diagram shown, all PCs can connect to the network, but the network is slow. Drag the three solutions which will provide the best performance result to the fields provided. Click Button 2 to continue this activity.
Upgrade to 802.11n-capable wireless devices.
Use 2.4 GHz for voice and video and 5 GHz for data traffic.
Use 2.4 GHz for data and 5 GHz for voice and video traffic.
Reboot all devices to clear all connections.
Move any furniture which may be blocking the WLAN signal.
Correct
You have successfully identified the troubleshooting solutions for this scenario. Click Button 2 to continue.
Incorrect
You have not successfully identified the troubleshooting solutions for this scenario. Click Reset to try again.
Check
Reset

Activity - Part 2: Identify the Troubleshooting Solution
In the diagram shown, wireless Client B cannot connect to the WLAN. Drag the four best solutions that would help troubleshoot connectivity to the WLAN to the fields provided. Click Button 3 to continue this activity.
Check encryption and security settings on the PC.
Use tracert to check network connectivity.
Reload PC network card drivers and firmware.
Connect the PC to a port on the wired network.
Use ipconfig to check network connectivity.
Ping the loopback address.
Correct
You have successfully identified the troubleshooting solutions for this scenario. Click Button 3 to continue.
Incorrect
You have not successfully identified the troubleshooting solutions for this scenario. Click Reset to try again.
Check
Reset

Activity - Part 3: Identify the Troubleshooting Solution
In the diagram shown, PC-A can connect to the WLAN. The connection is very slow and sometimes drops completely. Drag the five troubleshooting solutions which will provide information to correct these problems to the fields provided.
Check to see if there is a wireless alarm system nearby.
See if the AP and all switches are powered on.
Look for defective or loose cables on the wired LAN.
Move the laptop to another BSA or ESA.
See if the router has connectivity to the ISP.
Check channel settings.
Correct
You have successfully identified the troubleshooting solutions for this scenario.
Incorrect
You have not successfully identified the troubleshooting solutions for this scenario. Click Reset to try again.
Check
Reset
